name: constituent
content:
constituent noun [C]
(PART)
Add to word list
Add to word list
one of the parts that a substance or combination is made of: What are the basic constituents of the mixture?

constituent noun [C]
(PERSON)
a voter (= person who can vote) in a particular area of the country: The MP worked hard, always talking to his constituents and listening to their problems.

constituent adjective [before noun]
(PART)
relating to one of the parts that a substance or combination is made of: Let's look at the constituent parts of this sentence. The process of breaking down food into its constituent elements begins.
More examplesFewer examplesThe fluid tended to separate into its constituent components.Incorporate self-assessment material in each constituent module of any course.The telescope can split a star's light into its constituent colours.

constituent adjective [before noun]
(PERSON)
relating to a voter (= person who can vote) in a particular area of the country: The bill is an attempt to resolve a major source of constituent complaints. He thought it was very important to answer constituent mail.
More examplesFewer examplesThe bill does not limit the millions legislators spend on constituent mailings.He built his reputation on constituent service.We handle thousands of constituent requests every year.

constituent noun
(PERSON REPRESENTED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C usually pl ]
  politics & government a person represented by an elected official: The senator mails a newsletter to his constituents every two months.
constituent noun
(PART)
[ C ] one of the parts that a substance or mixture is made of: Oxygen is a constituent of air.
